meanings.def: (used to emphasize something) completely; in every way
examples: The train went slower and slower until it stopped altogether.
I don't altogether agree with you.
I am not altogether happy (= I am very unhappy) about the decision.
It was an altogether different situation.
I’m not altogether convinced, I’m afraid.

meanings.def: used to give a total number or amount
examples: We have invited fifty people altogether.
I am not altogether convinced by this argument.
Can you put your books all together in this box?
Let’s sing ‘Happy Birthday’. All together now!

meanings.def: used to introduce a summary when you have mentioned a number of different things
examples: The food was good and we loved the music. Altogether it was a great evening.
